p: Azadirachta indica. Azadirachta indica extract is appraised to contain bioactive compounds which dictate its potencies against P. vivax and P. falcifarum [ 82]. Ethanolic leaf extracts assessed in vivo absolutely inhibited P. berghei growth, at azadirachtin dosage of 50 mg/kg mouse body weight [ 83]. The in vivo antiplasmodial potency of aqueous and ethanolic leaf extracts was examined in P. berghei-infected BALB/c mice at dosage of 50 to 200 mg/kg/day. Both extracts exhibited significant antiplasmodial potency in a dose-dependent technique which could be due to the active antiplasmodial compounds screened [ 56].
